intro: Opilia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf opilia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, narrow leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Opilia angustifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
